before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"fv4lq","text":"Use 75% ethanol and 10% bleach to clean the lab bench, tube racks, pipettes, centrifuges (mini and large), and vortex before taking out any reagents. Turn on the hot plate (low setting; 55°C). If you're returning after sample incubation is done, place the DNA Elution Buffer on the hot plate and set it to the high setting (70°C). The bottle heats up faster if it is turned sideways.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":256,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"2vluq","text":"How to complete DNA extraction from solid tissues (fresh, stored in ethanol, or frozen).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"eqsdc","text":"Our protocols are constantly evolving and old versions will be deleted.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8cdt","text":"The documents here are not intended to be cited in publications","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"3bu7e","text":"Prepare tissues during this prep with the scissors/forceps in the drawer below the main lab bench. Be sure to use a clean petri dish and cleaned scissors/forceps for each sample. Be very careful not to cross-contaminate!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":166,"length":11},{"style":"italic","offset":179,"length":41}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"259vu","text":"This protocol requires the Zymo Research Miniprep Extraction Kit (big yellow and green box).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a8akm","text":"Optionally, follow along with this supplementary tutorial video as you perform the protocol:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9qkaf","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a8nmp","text":"Double check that you have appropriately scaled this protocol for the number of samples you need to prep (use scale option after clicking \"run\").","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"72taq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7qkl2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"embed","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"code":"\u003ciframe width=\"560\" height=\"315\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/nGkkiR-IlAc\" title=\"YouTube video player\" frameborder=\"0\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture\" allowfullscreen\u003e\u003c/iframe\u003e","guid":"390E6E008B9F11EB941487410C304A4A"}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":209,"offset":0,"style":"italic"},{"length":1,"offset":20,"style":"bold"},{"length":12,"offset":71,"style":"bold"},{"length":38,"offset":89,"style":"bold"}],"key":"dcpvk","text":"IF OPENING A NEW KIT (or prepping a new Proteinase K): To the powdered Proteinase K, add 1,040uL of Proteinase K Storage Buffer. Mix (vortex) very well until clear. Store in frost-free freezer when not in use.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7l787","text":"Create a master-mix for this step if you're running more than a few samples. To create the Extraction Master Mix, combine    +    +    (volumes are scaled; amount for single sample would be 95 uL Water, 95 uL Solid Tissue Buffer, 10 uL Proteinase K). You may need multiple microcentrifuge tubes (or a 15-mL tube from the cabinet containing the plastic Petri dishes) to make your mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":91,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":122,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":127,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":132,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dn911","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"95","guid":"8BAA5E50A6D311EAB25813B74081C93F","id":0,"label":"Water","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"95","guid":"932112F0A6D311EAB25813B74081C93F","id":0,"label":"Solid Tissue Buffer (blue)","unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"10","guid":"A0BF3FE0A6D311EAB25813B74081C93F","id":0,"label":"Proteinase K","unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4j0t9","text":"For each sample that you are extracting, label a 1.6-mL microcentrifuge tube with the corresponding lab or BIC code and aliquot 200 uL of Extraction Master Mix. Using the dissection tools (scissors, forceps, and scalpel if necessary), plastic Petri dishes filled with 95% ethanol, a beaker filled with 95% ethanol to clean tools in between samples, and the glass alcohol lamp (filled with 100% ethanol) to sterilize tools in between samples, isolate a tissue subsample (\u003c 25 mg, ethanol-stored or frozen tissue) and add it to the corresponding sample's microcentrifuge tube containing 200 uL of Extraction Master Mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":128,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":138,"length":21},{"style":"bold","offset":585,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":594,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2u6pf","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b2lko","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8f5b7","text":"Mix thoroughy (vortex) 10-15 seconds. Check that there is not tissue stuck to the top or sides of the tube (spin down briefly if necessary, using the mini centrifuge).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":23,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":6,"offset":234,"style":"bold"},{"length":22,"offset":243,"style":"bold"}],"key":"91cn5","text":"Make sure to briefly dry the tissue subsample of any residual ethanol (which may interfere with downstream applications like PCR) by placing it on a kimwipe prior to inputting it into the corresponding microcentrifuge tube containing 200 uL of Extraction Master Mix.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6k27o","text":"Incubate at    for  1-3 hrs (can also incubate longer or overnight if needed, but beware of DNA degradation). Optional timers available here:       ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":20,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":12,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":143,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":145,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":147,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"1EA6D8F0A6D411EAB25813B74081C93F","id":0,"label":"","temperature":"55","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"9CF23CE0A6D411EAB25813B74081C93F","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":7200,"guid":"A068ED10A6D411EAB25813B74081C93F","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"3":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":10800,"guid":"8E0345E4A6D411EA9DB10A58A9FEAC2A","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"884pf","text":"After removing samples from the hot plate, change the temperature setting to high (65-70°C) and keep the DNA Elution Buffer on the hotplate until it is required in step 10.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":105,"length":3},{"style":"bold","offset":109,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ioee","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b6mbk","text":"Mix (vortex) samples and spin down briefly if needed to remove liquid from the cap/sides of the tube. Add 400 uL Genomic Binding Buffer to each tube. Mix thoroughly (vortex) 10-15 seconds.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":106,"length":29},{"style":"bold","offset":174,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"sv08","text":"Centrifuge  . Meanwhile, prepare a Collection Tube and Zymo-spin IIC-XLR Column for each sample (be sure to label the lid of the Column!).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":11,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"12000","duration":60,"guid":"19AB19F0A6D511EAB25813B74081C93F","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6gs6r","text":"Transfer only the aqueous supernatant from each tube (no insoluble debris!) from each sample's microcentrifuge tube to the appropriate labeled Column. Centrifuge  . Discard the Collection Tube (solid waste) and the flow through (liquid waste) and place the Columns into new Collection Tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":26,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":162,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"12000","duration":60,"guid":"70D327BAA6DE11EA9DB10A58A9FEAC2A","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"kuuk","text":"Add 400 uL DNA Pre-Wash Buffer to each Column (new Collection Tube). Centrifuge  . Empty the Collection Tube into the liquid waste (don't discard the Collection Tube this time). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":80,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"12000","duration":60,"guid":"A3C3E0E6A6DE11EA9DB10A58A9FEAC2A","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7m99m","text":"Add 700 uL Wash Buffer to each Column. Centrifuge  . Empty the Collection Tube into the liquid waste container (don't discard Collection Tube). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":50,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"12000","duration":60,"guid":"D4ECEB22A6DE11EA9DB10A58A9FEAC2A","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2gtt4","text":"Add 200 uL Wash Buffer to each Column. Centrifuge  . Discard the Collection Tube (solid waste) and the flow through (liquid waste) and place the Columns into new, labeled microcentrifuge tubes (caps will be open in order to accommodate the Columns).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":50,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"12000","duration":60,"guid":"F1BF4CBAA6DE11EA9DB10A58A9FEAC2A","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3pqgu","text":"Add ≥ 50 uL Elution Buffer (the buffer should be at 65-70ºC by now). Standard protocol is to use 75 uL of Elution Buffer for a single elution. Incubate for 5 minutes (optional timer here   ) at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":3,"length":23},{"style":"bold","offset":97,"length":24},{"style":"bold","offset":156,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":187,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c5oau","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"97B65C10A6DF11EAB25813B74081C93F","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cm47c","text":"Centrifuge   to elute the DNA. The eluted DNA can be used immediately for molecular-based applications or stored at \u003c 20ºC for future use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":11,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"66d3g","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"agjii","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"14850","duration":60,"guid":"AF34FE20A6DF11EA9DB10A58A9FEAC2A","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":249,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"693bf","text":"To increase DNA yield, you may complete two elutions/incubations by repeating steps 10 and 11 instead of just one. You can also try increasing the incubation time to up to 10 minutes. Return the elution buffer to the hot plate between elution steps.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"18igi","text":"Clean the centrifuge after completing steps 1-11!!! Please refer to the video tutorial if you need a refresher on how to do this.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":52},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":52}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: DNA Extraction (solid tissues)
